alert.note: Alert for Grant (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 11 at 3:43PM PST until January 11 at 4:15PM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: The National Weather Service in Spokane has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southwestern Grant County in north central Washington... * Until 415 PM PST. * At 342 PM PST, a dangerous snow squall was located along Interstate 90 between Vantage and George. HAZARD...Flash freeze on roads. Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts up to 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous and life-threatening travel conditions are expected in the warning area. This includes Interstate 90 in Washington between mile markers 138 and 149. Locations impacted include... George. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Wet roadways will quickly freeze. Black ice will cause roads, bridges, and overpasses to become slick and dangerous. Slow down and be prepared for a sudden loss of traction. Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED SNOW SQUALL IMPACT...SIGNIFICANT
